title: 14-year-old arrested after man kicked into moving train at Back Bay
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 14-year-old boy was arrested for allegedly kicking a man into a moving Orange Line train at Back Bay Station.
The teen will be charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon for the February 18 incident.
The 27-year-old victim sustained a forehead injury but was conscious; the investigation by Transit Police is ongoing.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a news quiz to test knowledge of recent Greater Boston stories.
The quiz covers trending local stories, encouraging readers to stay informed.
Peter Chianca, general assignment editor, oversees content creation since 2019.

title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Hearth & Hug Bakery in Somerville launched 'Bye Bridget' merchandise following criticism for donating to a food bank.
Owner Natalie Hug responded to an internet critic by creating branded tees, stickers, and baby onesies as a rebuttal.
Proceeds from the 'Bye Bridget' merchandise will be donated to charity, continuing the bakery's charitable efforts.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gerard "Jerry" Boucher, 72, and Kathleen "Kit" Boucher, 71, died after falling through ice at Bee’s River in Eastham.
The couple, known for their community involvement, had lived in Eastham since 2008 and often walked their black lab there.
Daughter Katy Boucher encourages acts of kindness in memory of her parents, who were active in community service.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three fires in Fitchburg are being investigated as potential arson cases, State Fire Marshal Jon Davine announced.
Two February fires occurred at an apartment building on Blossom and Day streets without significant spread, officials reported.
A third fire on Myrtle Avenue injured one person and displaced seven; it is apparently unrelated to the others.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, 'Grey's Anatomy' star, died from ALS at 53, less than a year after announcing his diagnosis.
Dane became an ALS awareness advocate, speaking in Washington and being recognized with the Advocate of the Year award.
He is survived by his wife Rebecca Gayheart and their two daughters; their complex relationship remained supportive post-separation.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Mass. State Police members charged in recruit Enrique Delgado-Garcia's death are suspended with pay.
Lt. Jennifer Penton faces additional perjury charges, accused of lying about Delgado-Garcia's concussion-like symptoms.
Independent reviews of training programs are ongoing, including by the International Association of Chiefs of Police.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police are preparing for a potential 'takeover' at South Shore Plaza scheduled for Friday evening.
The event was promoted on social media, raising concerns due to previous violent street takeovers in Massachusetts.
Authorities plan to monitor the situation closely and have developed a coordinated response with law enforcement partners.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins views the Boston Celtics as a 'dark horse' to win the 2026 NBA title if Jayson Tatum returns.
The Celtics have a 35-19 record without Tatum, sitting second in the Eastern Conference, despite key offseason departures.
Jaylen Brown is considered an MVP contender by Perkins, noted for his top-5 scoring and defensive performance this season.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The Patriots are exploring wide receiver upgrades, with AJ Brown frequently mentioned as a potential trade target.
ESPN proposed a trade with the Patriots giving up 2026 first, third, and sixth-round picks for AJ Brown and a 2026 second-round pick.
AJ Brown, under contract through 2029, had 1,003 yards last season and consistently scored seven touchdowns annually for the past three years.
